documentation.content:
[View Workload Details](https://console.cloud.google.com/kubernetes/deployment/${metric_or_resource.label.location}/${metric_or_resource.label.cluster_name}/${metric_or_resource.label.namespace_name}/${metric.label.metadata_system_top_level_controller_name}/observability?project=${metric_or_resource.label.project_id}).
- Container restarts are commonly caused by memory/cpu usage issues and application failures.
- By default, this alert notifies an incident when there is a container restart in a 5 minute window. If alerts tend to be false positive or noisy, consider visiting the alert policy page and changing the threshold, the rolling (alignment) window, and the retest (duration) window. [View Documentation](https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/alerts/concepts-indepth).
- We recommend troubleshooting this incident with the [interactive playbook](https://console.cloud.google.com/monitoring/dashboards/gke-troubleshooting/crashloop?project=${PROJECT_ID}&f.sd_ts_playbook.cluster_name=${CLUSTER_NAME}&f.sd_ts_playbook.location=${CLUSTER_LOCATION}) for restarting containers, which shows detailed instructions, metrics, and logs.

conditionThreshold.filter: resource.type = "k8s_container" AND (resource.labels.cluster_name = "${CLUSTER_NAME}" AND resource.labels.location = "${CLUSTER_LOCATION}" AND resource.labels.project_id = "${PROJECT_ID}" AND resource.labels.namespace_name = "${NAMESPACE}") AND metric.type = "kubernetes.io/container/restart_count" AND (metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_name = "${WORKLOAD_NAME}" AND metadata.system_labels.top_level_controller_type = "${TOP_LEVEL_CONTROLLER_TYPE}")
